de.polygonal.ds.HashTable<K, T>

type
class
implements
Map<K, T>

An array hash table for mapping Hashable keys to generic elements.

The implementation is based on IntIntHashTable.

Worst-case running time in Big O notation

Constructor

new(slotCount : Int, ?capacity : Int, ?isResizable : Bool, ?maxSize : Int)

parameters
slotCount the total number of slots into which the hashed keys are distributed. This defines the space-time trade off of the hash table. Increasing the slotCount reduces the computation time (read/write/access) of the hash table at the cost of increased memory use. This value is fixed and can only be changed by calling rehash(), which rebuilds the hash table (expensive).
capacity the initial physical space for storing the key/value pairs at the time the hash table is created. This is also the minimum allowed size of the hash table and cannot be changed in the future. If omitted, the initial capacity equals slotCount. The capacity is automatically adjusted according to the storage requirements based on two rules:
  1. If the hash table runs out of space, the capacity is doubled (if isResizable is true).
  2. If the size falls below a quarter of the current capacity, the capacity is cut in half while the minimum capacity can't fall below capacity.
isResizable if false, the hash table is treated as fixed size table. Thus adding a value when size() equals capacity throws an error. Otherwise the capacity is automatically adjusted. Default is true.
maxSize the maximum allowed size of this hash table. The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError slotCount is not a power of two (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError capacity is not a power of two (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError capacity is < 2 (debug only).

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

reuseIterator : Bool

If true, reuses the iterator object instead of allocating a new one when calling iterator().
The default is false.
If true, nested iterations are likely to fail as only one iteration is allowed at a time.

Instance Methods

clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, nullifies all keys and values and shrinks the hash table to the initial capacity defined in the constructor.
Removes all key/value pairs.
n

clone(?assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this hash table. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

inline clr(key : K) : Bool

returns
true if key is successfully removed.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError key is null (debug only).
Removes and nullifies the first occurrence of key.
Only the key is nullified, to nullifiy the value call pack(). n

contains(val : T) : Bool

Same as has(). n

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all key/values.
If "alchemy memory" is used, always call this method when the life cycle of this object ends to prevent a memory leak. n

inline get(key : K) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError key is null (debug only).
Returns the value that is mapped to key or null if key does not exist. n

getAll(key : K, values : Array<T>) : Int

returns
the total number of values mapped to key.
Stores all values that are mapped to key in values or returns 0 if key does not exist.

inline getCapacity() : Int

The size of the allocated storage space for the key/value pairs.
If more space is required to accomodate new elements, the capacity is doubled every time size() grows beyond capacity, and split in half when size() is a quarter of capacity. The capacity never falls below the initial size defined in the constructor.

getCollisionCount() : Int

Counts the total number of collisions.
A collision occurs when two distinct keys are hashed into the same slot.

inline getFront(key : K) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError key is null (debug only).
Returns the value that is mapped to key or null if key does not exist.
Uses move-to-front-on-access which reduces access time when similar keys are frequently queried. n

inline getLoadFactor() : Float

The load factor measure the "denseness" of a hash table and is proportional to the time cost to look up an entry.
E.g. assuming that the keys are perfectly distributed, a load factor of 4.0 indicates that each slot stores 4 keys, which have to be sequentially searched in order to find a value.
A high load factor thus indicates poor performance. If the load factor gets too high, additional slots can be allocated by calling rehash().

inline getSlotCount() : Int

The total number of allocated slots.

inline has(val : T) : Bool

Returns true if this map contains a mapping for the value val. n

inline hasKey(key : K) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError key is null (debug only).
Returns true if this map contains key. n

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this hash table is empty. 1

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new HashTableValIterator object to iterate over all values contained in this hash table.
The values are visited in a random order.

keys() : Itr<K>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new HashTableKeyIterator object to iterate over all keys stored in this map. The keys are visited in a random order. n

pack() : Void

For performance reasons the hash table does nothing to ensure that empty locations contain null.
pack() therefore nullifies all obsolete references. n

rehash(slotCount : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError slotCount is not a power of two (debug only).
Redistributes all keys over slotCount.
This is an expensive operations as the hash table is rebuild from scratch. n

inline remap(key : K, val : T) : Bool

returns
true if val was successfully remapped to key.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError key is null (debug only).
Remaps the first occurrence of key to a new value val. n

remove(val : T) : Bool

returns
true if val was removed, false if val does not exist.
Removes all occurrences of the value val. n

inline set(key : K, val : T) : Bool

returns
true if key was added for the first time, false if another instance of key was inserted.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError out of space - hash table is full but not resizable.
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError key is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Maps the value val to key.
The method allows duplicate keys.
To ensure unique keys either use hasKey() before set() or setIfAbsent() n

inline setIfAbsent(key : K, val : T) : Bool

returns
true if key was mapped to val for the first time.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError out of space - hash table is full but not resizable.
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError key is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Maps val to key in this map, but only if key does not exist yet.
n

inline size() : Int

The total number of key/value pairs. 1

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an unordered array containing all values in this hash table.

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns an unordered dense array containing all values in this hash table.

toKeyArray() : Array<K>

Creates and returns an unordered array of all keys. n

toKeyDA() : DA<K>

Creates and returns an unordered dense array of all keys. n

toKeySet() : Set<K>

Creates a ListSet object of the keys in this map. n

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Example:
	  class Foo extends de.polygonal.ds.HashableItem
	  {
	      var value:Int;

	      public function new(value:Int) {
	          super();
	          this.value = value;
	      }

	      public function toString():String {
	          return "{Foo value: " + value + "}";
	      }
	  }

	  class Main
	  {
	      static function main() {
	          var hash = new de.polygonal.ds.HashTable<Foo, String>(16);
	          for (i in 0...4) hash.set(new Foo(i), "foo"  + i);
	          trace(hash);
	      }
	  }
	  {HashTable, size/capacity: 4/16, load factor: 0.25 }
	  |<
	    {Foo value: 0} -> foo0
	    {Foo value: 1} -> foo1
	    {Foo value: 2} -> foo2
	    {Foo value: 3} -> foo3
	  >|

toValSet() : Set<T>

Creates a ListSet object of the values in this map. n

toVector() : flash.Vector<Dynamic>

Returns a Vector.<T> object containing all values in this hash table.
